title.value: TAAL: Test-time Augmentation for Active Learning in Medical Image Segmentation
title.justification: This is the title of the paper.
title.quote: TAAL: Test-time Augmentation for Active Learning in Medical Image Segmentation

extractions.description: This paper proposes Test-time Augmentation for Active Learning (TAAL), a novel semi-supervised active learning approach for segmentation that exploits the uncertainty information offered by data transformations.

type.justification: The paper proposes a novel method and evaluates it empirically, it therefore falls under empirical research.
type.quote: Our results on a publicly-available dataset of cardiac images show that TAAL outperforms existing baseline methods in both fully-supervised and semi-supervised settings.

name.justification: The paper focuses on medical image segmentation, a subfield of medical imaging.
name.quote: In such context, medical image segmentation emerges as a remarkably relevant task for active learning.

name.justification: The paper is focused on active learning, a subfield of machine learning.
name.quote: One solution to that problem is offered by active learning (AL) [1].

name.justification: The paper focuses on semi-supervised learning, a subfield of machine learning.
name.quote: Semi-supervised learning (SSL) exploits the representations of unlabeled data to improve the performance of the task model.

name.justification: The paper states that they use a standard 4-layer UNet for their backbone segmentation model.
name.quote: We employ a standard 4-layer UNet [27] for our backbone segmentation model with dropout (p = 0.5), batch normalization and a leaky ReLU activation function.

is_contributed.justification: The paper does not state that they created a novel architecture for this model.
is_contributed.quote: We employ a standard 4-layer UNet [27] for our backbone segmentation model with dropout (p = 0.5), batch normalization and a leaky ReLU activation function.

is_executed.justification: The paper states that they use a standard 4-layer UNet for their backbone segmentation model.
is_executed.quote: We employ a standard 4-layer UNet [27] for our backbone segmentation model with dropout (p = 0.5), batch normalization and a leaky ReLU activation function.

is_compared.quote: We employ a standard 4-layer UNet [27] for our backbone segmentation model with dropout (p = 0.5), batch normalization and a leaky ReLU activation function.

referenced_paper_title.value: U-Net: Convolutional Networks for Biomedical Image Segmentation
referenced_paper_title.justification: The authors of the paper reference another paper when mentioning the UNet model.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We employ a standard 4-layer UNet [27] for our backbone segmentation model with dropout (p = 0.5), batch normalization and a leaky ReLU activation function.
